d4fd2e92-7676-4c48-9d7d-7c78d2203c24: A character can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, denote one target within his line of sight as his quarry. He receives a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made against his quarry, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats are automatically confirmed. A character can have no more than one quarry at a time.
ff2668d1-498a-455d-8386-8e685acb0faa: A demonslayer adds the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to his spell list: 1st — {g|SpellsProtectionFromEvil}protection from evil{/g}; 2nd — {g|SpellsCommunalProtectionFromEvil}protection from evil, communal{/g}.
11ff69ee-8d00-40b3-b4a7-d09c0be63c50: A freebooter is a natural leader, a pirate who works well with a variety of people and in a variety of roles. Her specialized combat tactics help organize and direct a crew, and freebooters' talents are in high demand. Most freebooters work as independent agents. A freebooter signs on with a crew when she feels the urge to travel, and often moves to a new ship when her contract ends.
2678ab44-2715-4b0a-85fa-624e2f04126c: A ranger forms a bond with his companions. This bond allows him to spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to grant half his favored enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against a single target of the appropriate type to all allies within 30 feet who can see or hear him. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the ranger's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1). This bonus does not stack with any favored enemy bonuses possessed by his allies; they use whichever bonus is higher.
41c77a73-5e57-4bb0-bf58-364427f53b6c: A ranger is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
3a91f722-9060-46bc-aa83-b7391448b8c1: A ranger of 17th level or higher can use the Camouflage in any terrain.
910ad4ee-9167-49ff-8bdf-81ab9fdd4ea0: A ranger of 20th level becomes a master hunter. He can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a favored enemy at his full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}attack bonus{/g}. If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the ranger's level + the ranger's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. A ranger can use this ability once per day against each of his favorite enemy types. He can't use it against the same creature more than once in a 24-hour period.
b626fd28-b92e-4766-a1c8-f5a18a3fb891: An espionage expert gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
130bd771-567c-40e0-ae17-62069df2a530: An espionage expert gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to bluff) and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}.
d07ea8bc-5d2f-4003-868f-ebea4d6a9863: An espionage expert of 20th level becomes an espionage master. She can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a favored enemy at her full attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the espionage expert's level + the espionage expert's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. An espionage expert can use this ability five times per day, but not against the same creature more than once in a 24-hour period.
1ec229bf-204e-4b9e-ae52-d8878510b1d0: At 10th level, a flamewarden adds {g|SpellsSummonMediumFireElemental}summon medium fire elemental{/g} to his ranger {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list as a 3rd-level spell.
eb02a2c4-7439-46ae-922a-d643ff004818: At 11th level, a stormwalker can move across the battlefield like a bolt of lightning. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, he can transform into lightning and move to any unoccupied square within 50 feet without provoking {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. He makes a single {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} against closest opponent after this movement.
a89142b0-0939-47ab-84fa-e8218d89ad2e: At 11th level, when a demonslayer chooses an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g} outsider as his quarry, he can the forgo the normal +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} and instead treat his weapon as if it were good-aligned versus his quarry.
701fa1a1-3f2b-4840-b297-68af24206b35:
At 12th level, a flamewarden can use the cleansing power of fire to remove afflictions from his body, mind, and soul. When the flamewarden takes 10 or more points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, he removes the following conditions: {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g}, {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g}, {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}, {g|ConditionExhausted}exhausted{/g}, {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g}, and {g|ConditionNauseated}nauseated{/g}. Additionally, he removes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} and 1d6 points of ability drain from the most {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} of his choice.
The ranger can use this ability only once each time he takes fire damage, regardless of how much damage it deals over the required amount. He can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
If the flamewarden has fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire, fire damage he would have otherwise taken still counts toward activating burning renewal.
d5631aa5-fa1a-4503-896d-f0a0c4110ad3: At 13th level, a flamewarden adds {g|SpellsFlameStrike}flamestrike{/g}, {g|SpellsVolcanicStorm}volcanic storm{/g}, and {g|SpellsSummonLargeFireElemental}summon large fire elemental{/g} to his ranger {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list as 4th-level spells.
f14ad35b-d016-4419-97e0-826bb8de103b: At 16th level, a stormwalker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity.
d0c8920d-7e17-4912-8449-8c3fb1e3bcdf: At 16th level, if a flamewarden dies, his body explodes in a conflagration in a 20-foot spread. Each hostile creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}10d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the ranger's level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The flames don't harm the flamewarden's allies, who instead are {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} 5d6 points of damage, and any poisons they are currently suffering are neutralized.
9f395791-f9c9-4d45-92d0-33aeb80dac31: At 19th level, the character's ability to hunt his quarry improves. He can now select a quarry as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} and his insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} his quarry increases to +4.
66b3b157-bcab-45b4-83c3-fca4864e4495: At 19th level, when a demonslayer chooses an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g} outsider as his quarry, he can forgo the normal +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} and instead treat his weapon as if it had the holy weapon special ability while attacking his quarry.
ad7df776-478e-4f19-a72e-7a36baf6243c: At 19th level, when a stormwalker uses flash step, he can make two {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} after his movement. Both of these {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are made at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}.
09264d44-fe44-44c8-9859-2433bfb636dd: At 1st level, a demonslayer must choose favored enemy ({g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g} outsider). At 5th level and every time he advances his favored enemy bonus, the demonslayer must advance his bonus against evil outsiders. In addition to the normal benefits of favored enemy, a demonslayer gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his favored enemy bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}, and supernatural abilities of evil outsiders.
fba9fd38-6840-408f-bd2e-e017a04284f4:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
f7e1d5b6-0c70-4b48-87fd-525e0264a1d4:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
Demons of Magic are the group of demons who prefer to use {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} in battle. Some of the Demons of Magic are dretch, oolioddroo, and succubus.
d4f7c52c-ad4e-466a-b9b4-92d10a283a8a:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
Demons of Slaughter is a group of demons who use martial weapons and have a lot of attacks or special attack effects, such as sneak attack. Some of the Demons of Slaughter are babau, cambion, and incubus.
353994ce-14cb-431b-8c1a-3f475e752b70:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.
Demons of Strength is a group of demons who use martial weapons and powerful attacks. Some of the Demons of Strength are balor, nalfeshnee, and vavakia.
19eaef72-f8c3-4dac-8974-ababb11ae636: At 1st level, the freebooter can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, indicate an enemy in combat and rally her allies to focus on that target. The freebooter and her allies gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against the target. At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the bonus increases by 1. The freebooter's bane lasts until the target dies or the freebooter selects a new target.
2106421b-876b-45be-a2a2-a0040d6fb737: At 20th level, freebooter becomes a master hunter. She can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a target of freebooter's bane at her full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}attack bonus{/g}. If the attack hits, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the freebooter's level + the freebooter's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. A freebooter can use this ability four times per day, but not against the same creature more than once in a 24-hour period.
86a09d90-aee7-455c-84b4-a5008ae758b2: At 20th level, the flamewarden gains {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire, and once per day, the flamewarden rises from the ashes of his own destruction 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after dying. The flamewarden's body re-forms with all his equipment, and he returns to life with half his maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}.
a16d74c5-ee19-45c2-a01a-c4d50ec4430b: At 20th level, the slayer becomes a master at capturing or killing his studied targets. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a studied target at his full attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. If the attack succeeds, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for this save is 10 + 1/2 the slayer's level + the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. Whether or not the target succeeds, it cannot be targeted by this ability again (by any slayer) for 24 hours.
130fd646-0c50-4ecd-a54e-48e5e4b8eaf8:
At 2nd level, a ranger must select one combat style to pursue.
The ranger's expertise manifests in the form of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} at 2nd, 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level. He can choose feats from his selected combat style's list, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites.
Every style can also choose the following feats: Dodge, Great Fortitude, Lightning Reflexes, Toughness.
d30ec7dc-c6e6-42a2-a400-a3200adc0b5a:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Cleave, Power Attack, and Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, he adds Cleaving Finish and Great Cleave to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Dreadful Carnage and Critical Focus to the list.
c4898332-5347-49a4-bb1e-e59a5e040cee:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Dazzling Display, Power Attack, and Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, he adds Cornugon Smash and Shatter Defenses to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Dreadful Carnage and Improved Critical to the list.
226e36af-97b8-40ad-9549-195635242cf0:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Double Slice, Shield Bash, and Two-Weapon Fighting.
At 6th level, he adds Improved Two-Weapon Fighting to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Greater Two-Weapon Fighting to the list.
39ae1181-4eb0-4fb6-8267-674769ac8f52:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, he adds Improved Precise Shot, Point-Blank Master, and Manyshot to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Improved Critical to the list.
3bdd7135-b276-488e-a196-3734b56f6399:
At 2nd level, the ranger can select from Shield Bash, Shield Focus, and Two-Weapon Fighting.
At 6th level, he adds Improved Two-Weapon Fighting and Shield Master to the list.
At 10th level, he adds Bashing Finish and Greater Two-Weapon Fighting to the list.
3e519a53-b4f9-436b-8279-19528fc02989: At 3rd level, a demonslayer gains insight into his Abyssal enemies. The demonslayer gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half his {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
6f8b209e-170a-465a-aa16-515fca0f7e6f:
At 3rd level, a ranger may select a type of terrain. The ranger gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} when he is in this terrain.
At 8th level and every five levels thereafter, the ranger may select an additional favored terrain. In addition, at each such interval, the skill bonus and initiative bonus in any one favored terrain (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
6c87e7dc-4abd-4ce4-99ac-e00867737c3b: At 4th level, a flamewarden adds firebelly and summon small fire elemental to his ranger {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list as 1st-level spells.
6f612fcd-da52-435e-b894-88aa24b7b2a1: At 4th level, a flamewarden can cause his weapons to burst into flame. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the ranger can grant a single weapon he holds the flaming special ability for 1 minute; while under this effect, the weapon counts as magic for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. A flamewarden can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. At 12th level, weapons affected by this ability gain the flaming burst special ability instead.
fa088d0c-be96-4bc4-8427-e5efe119a3b4: At 4th level, a freebooter forms a bond with her crewmates. This bond allows her to spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to grant her allies extra combat prowess when they work as a team. All allies within 30 feet who can see or hear the freebooter gain an additional +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} when {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} for 1 minute.
82fb9a25-2596-4650-9c0f-9a8b2f04b2a4:
At 4th level, a ranger forms a bond with his hunting companions. This bond can take one of two forms. Once the form is chosen, it cannot be changed.
The first is a bond to his companions. This bond allows him to spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} to grant half his favored enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against a single target of the appropriate type to all allies within 30 feet who can see or hear him. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the ranger's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1). This bonus does not stack with any favored enemy bonuses possessed by his allies; they use whichever bonus is higher.
The second option is to form a close bond with an animal companion. A ranger who selects an animal companion can choose one from the list of available creatures. This animal is a loyal companion that accompanies the ranger on his adventures as appropriate for its kind. A ranger's animal companion shares his favored enemy and favored terrain bonuses.
This ability functions like the druid animal companion ability, except that the ranger's effective druid level is equal to his ranger level –3.
74bf39b3-fb34-4561-ba90-98b909c58d4b: At 4th level, a stormwalker can wreathe his weapon in lightning. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can grant a single weapon he holds the shock special ability for 1 minute; while under this effect, the weapon counts as magic for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. A stormwalker can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. At 12th level, weapons affected by this ability gain the shocking burst special ability.
82043a4f-02b9-4e4f-9478-b1240f458392: At 5th level, a nomad gains the Point-Blank Master {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, ignoring all the prerequisites.
35b9365b-da4f-4872-a592-364f0256677b: At 7th level, a flamewarden adds {g|SpellsScorchingRay}scorching ray{/g} to his list ranger {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list as a 2nd-level spell.
fc2c81ab-6ac2-4565-be0e-ecc72cc69016:
At 9th level, a flamewarden can fan the last spark of a recently slain creature's life force back into a full flame. Once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, a flamewarden can touch the corpse of a creature to grant it the effects of {g|SpellsBreathOfLife}breath of life{/g}.
Breath of Life: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cures{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +25).
Unlike other spells that heal damage, breath of life can bring recently slain creatures back to life. If cast upon a creature that has died within 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, apply the healing from this spell to the creature. If the healed creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If the creature's hit point total is at a negative amount equal to or greater than its Constitution score, the creature remains dead. Creatures brought back to life through breath of life gain a temporary negative level that lasts for 1 day.
Creatures slain by death effects cannot be saved by breath of life.
Like cure spells, breath of life deals damage to undead creatures rather than curing them, and cannot bring them back to life.
40e84eab-66b0-4b87-81d1-25ffa836f425: Demonslayers are known for their expertise in the destruction of demons.
ddd48ffc-189d-45fa-b7fe-5bcd5a7c287f: Emulating the blazing phoenix, flamewardens sweep through the world like a selective forest fire, burning away corruption, evil, and those who cling to decay.
d4f8b695-89fd-464c-b328-0ad1d8799613: For some rangers living in vast plains, their horses are an irreplaceable part of their lives, and their bows are a natural extension of their arms.
11be51d6-7cb1-400f-8776-06e90d6cffc1: Ranger can form a special bond either with an animal companion, or with their party. In the former case, the character chooses one of the available animals as a companion who can wear barding and advances along with the owner. In the latter case, they can give a part of their favored enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their teammates.
e196169e-6c8d-4968-aad5-886f70014dc7: Ranger chooses a type of enemies to gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit against. As they advance, they can choose new favored enemies and gain new advantages against the ones chosen before.
c8c3fd37-eae5-4702-9ea0-2ca5a67c7fe9: Rangers are adept at exterminating certain types of enemies. Rangers can become masters of any kind of weapons, depending on the combat style they choose. Thanks to their unique abilities, rangers are some of the best dual-wielding warriors.
b9379ca5-05d5-4430-aa65-19c44f78cd6c: Rangers are deft skirmishers, either in melee or at range, capable of skillfully dancing in and out of battle. Their abilities allow them to deal significant harm to specific types of foes, but their skills are valuable against all manner of enemies.
8cc5380b-10c0-44af-bd79-fdc11085613f: Rangers who walk in the tempest unafraid draw the power of the storm into themselves and become stormwalkers.
7e8be7c3-7147-4d16-b9a0-fb39e86ea6c7: These rangers' favorite hunting grounds aren't woods or mountains, but city streets and enemy headquarters. These masterful spies hunt for secrets, rather than meat, using lies and stealthiness as effectively as blades and arrows.
74812134-e71d-4fb6-bfa8-b80f53846200: This is a ranger's unique ability that determines their specialization — for example, fighting with two {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} weapons. It grants the ranger abilities that improve the chosen fighting style, even if they are usually available only to other classes.
e9f15dac-eb21-49b9-99e2-b41cc87c8951:
While in your favored terrain, you gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
Each time you select an additional favored terrain, the skill bonus and initiative bonus in any one favored terrain (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
9ea9d7b3-0688-4a72-a9c4-d749c65da923: While usually rangers use their {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} to cast divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, espionage experts use the power of their personality. The main casting ability for the espionage expert is {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}.
